item.title: Reynold's Number
item.description: I have no quarrel with time. I float, flow, will sink, not sync. Time herself has the indifference Of a schoolboyâ€™s secret crush, We stand invisible in suspense That perhaps the usual rules Will be suspended, in our case, And the surprise will be more time, Time long after we weary of it As we wearied of childhood and Its fabled happiness of endless August cut off from recess.
